decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Existing Elevations A3/02 REVB, Existing Plans A3/01 REVB, Proposed Plans A3/03 REVB, Block Plan Existing and Proposed A3/05 REVC, Proposed Elevations A3/04 REVC
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than five (5) persons within five (5) bedrooms.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines.

| Cycle storage for ^IN;  bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development (excluding demolition, initial site clearance and ground works), a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, including the aircraft noise data in Section 6, SPG10 (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with best practicable mitigation measures, as necessary, to achieve the criteria for external amenity spaces.
The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG (2016), policies 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG (2016), policies 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms adjoining bathroom of separate dwelling and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedrooms above commercial premises, adjoining communal staircase and above communal kitchen/dining/living room. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG (2016) and Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).
subdivision_of_building: Excludes the commercial unit at front ground floor
description: Change of use from residential dwelling (Use Class C3) to HMO for 5 people (Use Class C4), single storey side extension, single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing single storey rear extension) and provision of associated refuse and cycle storage facilities.
